steps.title: Citrus scents may also repel scorpions.
steps.content: Citrus scents may also repel scorpions. Light some citric candles around your home or outside in your yard. Do this every day for a few weeks or a month to see if it makes a difference in the number of scorpions you see. [1] X Research source You can also try spraying citrus oils on surfaces to repel scorpions. Mix about 20 drops of essential lemon oil with a couple cups of water in a spray bottle and spray it wherever you want to deter scorpions from going.

steps.title: There is evidence that lavender may repel scorpions.
steps.content: There is evidence that lavender may repel scorpions. Plant lavender around the perimeter of your home or yard to repel scorpions naturally. Or, plant lavender in certain areas where you tend to see scorpions on your property. [2] X Research source You can also try making a lavender spray by mixing a couple cups of water and 20 drops or so of lavender essential oil in a spray bottle. Spray the mixture onto any surfaces or areas you want to repel scorpions from.

steps.title: Chickens get rid of the insects that scorpions eat.
steps.content: Chickens get rid of the insects that scorpions eat. Keep a few chickens on your property and let them roam freely. Watch them happily peck away at the ground as they scour it for bugs, reducing the natural food supply for scorpions! [3] X Research source Chickens may also try to eat any scorpions they come across if they’re still coming onto your property.

steps.title: This gets rid of dark, appealing hiding places.
steps.content: This gets rid of dark, appealing hiding places. Clean up yard waste like piles of leaves and brush. Get rid of stacks of rocks or lumber as well. Move wood piles at least 50 ft (15 m) away from your home. [4] X Research source Scorpions hide out in dark places during the day and come out at night to hunt. [5] X Expert Source Samuel Ramsey, PhD Entomologist Expert Interview. 20 January 2021. Wear long-sleeved clothing and gloves when you’re cleaning up your property in case there are any scorpions hiding in piles of debris.

steps.title: This removes natural bridges that scorpions can use to get inside.
steps.content: This removes natural bridges that scorpions can use to get inside. Prune trees so their branches are not touching the sides of your home. That way, scorpions are less likely to find their way into your attic or through an open window. [6] X Research source Scorpions sometimes like to hang out in the shade underneath trees. Be careful when you’re pruning in case there are any nearby.

steps.title: Food scraps attract insects that scorpions feed on.
steps.content: Food scraps attract insects that scorpions feed on. Always sweep up crumbs, spilled pet food, and other scraps from inside and outside your home. Dispose of food scraps in a sealed trash can where insects can’t get to it. [7] X Research source If you have fruit trees, clean up any fallen fruit around your yard so it doesn’t rot and attract bugs.

steps.title: This prevents scorpions from finding their way inside through tiny spaces.
steps.content: This prevents scorpions from finding their way inside through tiny spaces. Walk slowly around the outside of your home and look for holes and gaps, especially around windows, doors, and the foundation. [8] X Expert Source Samuel Ramsey, PhD Entomologist Expert Interview. 20 January 2021. Seal everything up with caulk or spray foam. [9] X Research source Other places to check for gaps are around dryer vents and air conditioning ducts. [10] X Expert Source Samuel Ramsey, PhD Entomologist Expert Interview. 20 January 2021.

steps.title: This way, your lights attract less insects that scorpions like to eat.
steps.content: This way, your lights attract less insects that scorpions like to eat. Change all your outdoor light bulbs to warm, yellow bulbs to attract fewer bugs. Leave your lights off when you’re not using them. [11] X Research source Note that yellow light doesn’t deter insects, it just attracts them less than white light does.

steps.title: This can shift populations away from your property.
steps.content: This can shift populations away from your property. Wear protective clothing and gloves when hunting for scorpions. Pick a scorpion up with a long pair of kitchen tongs and pit it inside a jar. Seal the jar securely and transport the scorpion far away to an undisturbed natural habitat. [12] X Research source Scorpions come out more at night and they glow in the dark under black UV light. Buy a black light and go looking for scorpions at night to find more that you can catch and relocate.

steps.title: This removes sources of water that attract scorpions.
steps.content: This removes sources of water that attract scorpions. Fix leaky pipes so less water accumulates in and around your home for scorpions to drink. Repair leaky faucets and any other leaks in your home. [13] X Research source If you have any roof leaks, fix those as well so water doesn’t accumulate in your attic. If you have pets, leave water dishes empty at night or elevate them somewhere that scorpions can’t reach them.

steps.title: Fewer food sources means fewer scorpions.
steps.content: Fewer food sources means fewer scorpions. Check for infestations of things like termites, spiders, cockroaches, and other bugs. Kill them with pesticide or call a pest control company to deal with the problem. [14] X Trustworthy Source University of Missouri Extension University of Missouri program dedicated to research-based, practical public education Go to source Scorpions eat just about any small insect, but they especially love crickets, ants, and cockroaches.
